intro: Chamelaucium, commonly known as the coastal banksia, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. These plants are characterized by their tall, woody stems and distinctive, cone-like inflorescences that produce nectar. Chamelaucium species are typically found in coastal and sandy environments, where they thrive in well-drained soils. Their flowers are often visited by birds and insects, contributing to their ecological importance. The genus includes several species, each with unique adaptations to coastal conditions.
